definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: While personally a modest man, Dr LEE was a bold leader.
sentences.chinese: 李博士爲人謙和，同時也是一位大無畏的領導。

sentences.english: Facing the death, he has a good laugh, this is the what kind dauntless spirit.
sentences.chinese: 面對死亡，他仰天大笑，這是何等的大無畏精神。

sentences.english: They withstood the tests with wonderful power and sublime heroism.
sentences.chinese: 他們憑着神奇的力量和大無畏的英雄氣概經受了考驗。

sentences.english: Their fearlessness inspires others to overcome their own fears.
sentences.chinese: 她們的大無畏精神激勵別人戰勝自身的恐懼。

sentences.english: The people of Linzhou displayed a fearless spirit.
sentences.chinese: 林州人真有一股大無畏的氣概。

sentences.english: The author characterized the leading character in the novel as a dauntless hero.
sentences.chinese: 作者將小說中的主人公描繪成一個大無畏的英雄。

sentences.english: But I am abrupt so undaunted be like to have me only.
sentences.chinese: 但是我忽然這樣大無畏的似乎只有我一個。

sentences.english: The social practice also made me more and more scrupulous and dauntless .
sentences.chinese: 社會實踐也使我越來越嚴格和大無畏的。

definition: to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to follow through/to carry through to the end
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
by brute strength/rashly and forcefully/bull-headed/to work tenaciously with no fear of hardship
